name: One-Legged Calf Raises
how_to_perform:
1. Stand tall near a wall or a sturdy object for support, such as a chair or countertop.
2. Shift your weight to one leg (letâ€™s start with the right leg) and lift the other foot (left foot) off the ground by bending the knee behind you.
3. Place the ball of your right foot on the ground while your heel is hovering just above the floor.
4. Take a deep breath in.
5. As you exhale, begin to raise your right heel high off the ground by pushing through the ball of your foot. Keep your balance by lightly holding onto the sturdy object if needed.
6. Hold the raised position for a brief second, ensuring that your body remains upright and your posture is straight.
7. Gently lower your heel back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
8. Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other leg.
short_summary: One-Legged Calf Raises are an effective exercise for strengthening the calf muscles by raising and lowering one heel while standing on one foot.
